item.title: Hitler's Mein Kampf becomes bestseller in Germany
item.description: An annotated edition of Mein Kampf, Adolf Hitler's notorious manifesto, becomes a non-fiction bestseller in Germany.

media:group.media:description: The new edition is annotated to highlight the propoganda and mistakes in the original Mein Kampf. (Reuters: Michael Dalder)

item.title: Toddler saves twin brother from tipped over dresser
item.description: Footage of a two-year-old boy saving his twin brother from a fallen dresser is shared on social media as a warning to parents to secure furniture.

media:group.media:description: Mother of the children Kayli Shoff commenting on YouTube: You have my permission to share the video as long as you a) post the clip in its entirety and b) give proper attribution. Also, please inform your readers I was hesitant to share this video, but did so in order to spread awareness to other families.﻿ (YouTube: Kayli Shoff)

item.title: Fisherman dragged overboard by marlin survives six hours in ocean
item.description: A fisherman survives six hours treading water off the West Australian coast after a marlin he hooked pulls him overboard.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Hamlyn

media:group.media:description: Exmouth is a popular destination for big game fishing. (Audience submitted: Ian Stecky)

item.title: Sixers hand Heat their first loss of the Big Bash at the Gabba
item.description: Opener Dan Hughes inspires the Sydney Sixers' three wicket Big Bash League win at a sold out Gabba on Tuesday night, snapping Brisbane Heat's unbeaten season start.

media:group.media:description: Daniel Hughes led the way for the Sixers with a brilliant knock. (AAP: David Kapernick)

item.title: Pill testing at music festivals 'needed' after rave overdose
item.description: Drug experts renew calls for pill-testing facilities at music festivals after the death of a man from an unknown substance at a New Year's Eve rave in southern Queensland.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Gregory

media:group.media:description: Police were called to the YewbuNYE party on New Year's Day, where as many as 500 people are estimated to have gathered. (Instagram: darren_109)

item.title: Turkey closes in on nightclub gunman as 'selfie' video emerges
item.description: As Turkish authorities hunt the gunman who killed 39 people celebrating the New Year at an Istanbul nightclub, local media release a video of a man they say is the attacker filming himself with a mobile phone.

item.title: Endangered night parrot's drinking habits revealed
item.description: Scientists discover endangered night parrots leave the safety of their hideouts to drink at waterholes when the night-time temperature hits 40 degrees Celsius, in a breakthrough which could help save them from extinction.
item.dc:creator: Kathy McLeish

media:group.media:description: The night parrot is under threat from feral cats, which live near watering holes. (Suplied: Steve Murphy)

item.title: Thousands queue in US airports as customs systems crash
item.description: Thousands of travellers in the US are forced to wait hours in line after a customs computer system crashes at airports around the country.

media:group.media:description: Passengers around the country were left stranded for hours. (Twitter: @carlosrico001)

item.title: Indonesian police arrest ferry captain over fatal fire
item.description: Indonesian police arrest the captain of a tourist ferry that caught fire on New Year's Day, leaving 40 people dead or missing.

media:group.media:description: Search and rescue crews search for the victims in the charred remains of the ferry. (AP: Rhana Ananda)

item.title: Warner enjoying promising odd-couple partnership with Renshaw
item.description: Warner, who blasted a century before lunch against Pakistan, says he appreciates the way Renshaw kept his cool, and his wicket, down the other end.

media:group.media:description: Warner raced to his ton while Renshaw took his time down the other end. (AP: Rick Rycroft)

item.title: Aussie 16yo Destanee Aiava hoping to 'stay grounded' as tennis star rises
item.description: Destanee Aiava wraps up a breakthrough three-set victory over Bethanie Mattek-Sands to move through to the Brisbane International's second round.

media:group.media:description: It's Destanee ... The 16-year-old Aiava will meet Svetlana Kuznetsova in round two. (AAP: Dave Hunt)

item.title: Toddler missing from Tuggeranong home found safe
item.description: Police find a three-year-old girl who went missing from her Wanniassa home in south Canberra this afternoon.

item.title: Duterte welcomes Russian Navy ships as Manila forges Moscow ties
item.description: A Russian Navy anti-submarine ship and a sea tanker arrive in the Philippines for a goodwill visit amid President Rodrigo Duterte's moves to bolster ties with Moscow, including a possible weapons deal.

media:group.media:description: A Russian anti-submarine ship docks at the south harbour port area in Manila. (Reuters: Romeo Ranoco)

item.title: Storm warning alerts issued 'on time' despite complaints in Brisbane
item.description: Brisbane City Council says there were no problems with its storm warning system during Monday night's storm, despite more concerns that messages came through too late.
item.dc:creator: Melinda Howells

media:group.media:description: The Brisbane suburb of Newmarket was hammered with heavy rain for much of Monday evening. (Supplied: Paul Colmer)

item.title: Culleton goes to hospital after being served bankruptcy papers
item.description: Former One Nation senator Rod Culleton is discharged from hospital after a fracas outside a Perth court this morning, as a man attempted to serve him papers.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Laschon And Laura Gartry

media:group.media:description: Senator Culleton is undergoing X-rays for a suspected broken wrist. (AAP: Richard Wainwright)

item.title: 'It's renewed my faith in humanity': Trek to remember partner claimed by rare brain disease
item.description: After a rare brain disease took the life of John Olsen's partner, he honours her memory by hiking across the entire country in a bid to raise money for a cure.

media:group.media:description: John Olsen faced rough conditions on the road, including extreme heat. (Supplied: Mandy Bielby)

item.title: Centrelink staff to get 'customer aggression' training amid debt row
item.description: Beleaguered Centrelink staff will soon receive "Advanced Customer Aggression Training" as the government agency continues to face a public backlash over its new controversial debt recovery regime.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Greene

media:group.media:description: The Government has admitted one in five people who have received a letter did not owe money to Centrelink. (AAP Image: Dan Peled)

item.title: Warner blasts and Renshaw lasts as openers dominate Pakistan
item.description: Matt Renshaw scores a meticulous maiden Test ton, in total contrast to David Warner's historic before-lunch century, as Australia's openers pile on the runs against a struggling Pakistan on day one of the third Test.

media:group.media:description: Renshaw and Warner became the first Australian opening pairing to both notch tons since 2002. (AP: Rick Rycroft)

item.title: South Korean President refuses to testify in impeachment trial
item.description: South Korean President Park Geun-hye refuses to testify in a case that will decide her future following her impeachment over a corruption scandal, forcing a delay in legal arguments.

media:group.media:description: Park Geun-hye refuses to testify in her impeachment trial. (Wikimedia Commons: Korean Culture and Information Service)

item.title: Port Augusta power station ash could be toxic, SA Health says
item.description: Dust blowing across Port Augusta from the local former coal-fired power station has "toxic potential", an SA Health assessment finds.
item.dc:creator: Angelique Donnellan

media:group.media:description: Ash plumes from the defunct power station have intensified following severe weather. (ABC News: Khama Reid)

item.title: Stinky corpse flower's surprise re-blooming astonishes experts
item.description: A rare plant that smells like rotting flesh astonishes staff at the Adelaide Botanic Gardens after it produces a flower and a leaf together — a scenario they believe has "never happened anywhere in the world before".

media:group.media:description: The plant has simultaneously produced a flower and a leaf. (ABC News: Caroline Winter)

item.title: Share market starts 2017 with strong gain
item.description: The Australian share market kicks off the new year in some style, rising 1.2 per cent on its first trading day of 2017.
item.dc:creator: Michael Janda

media:group.media:description: The Australian share market rose 1.2 per cent on its first trading day of the year. (AAP)

item.title: Victorian Human Rights Commission website hacked
item.description: The Victorian Equal Opportunity and Human Rights Commission's website is taken over by a group claiming to be affiliated to international hacking group Anonymous, sending it offline for several hours.

media:group.media:description: The commission's website has been down for several hours. (ABC News)

item.title: WA mining stocks regain ground as commodities surge
item.description: After years in the doldrums, WA mining stocks are regaining ground with at least one company reporting a share price gain of more than 400 per cent in the past 12 months.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Laschon

media:group.media:description: Iron ore prices rose more than 80 per cent in 2016. (ABC News)

item.title: Speed a possible factor in Lake Trevallyn jet ski death: police
item.description: A jet ski rider may not have had time to avoid another rider who fell off his vehicle in Lake Trevallyn on Monday and later died, police say.
item.dc:creator: Sallese Gibson

media:group.media:description: Local lifesavers patrol Lake Trevallyn when events are scheduled. (ABC News: Sallese Gibson)

item.title: Four people freed after head-on crash
item.description: Emergency services free four people trapped following a head-on crash on the Tasman Highway near Buckland on Tasmania's East Coast.

media:group.media:description: The four occupants were taken to Royal Hobart Hospital. (ABC News: Pablo Vinales)

item.title: Labor vows to target WA's 120 worst young offenders
item.description: The worst juvenile offenders in WA would be targeted under an Opposition election promise to revive a program supporting dysfunctional families, amid ongoing problems at Banksia Hill Detention Centre.
item.dc:creator: Andrew O'Connor

media:group.media:description: The problems at Banksia Hill Juvenile Detention Centre prove a new approach is needed, Labor says. (ABC News: Robert Koenig-Luck)

item.title: Cairns paramedic allegedly kicked in back, spat on while treating patient
item.description: Two people appear in court charged with assault after a paramedic is allegedly kicked in the back and spat on in far north Queensland, the latest in a spate of attacks on emergency service personnel working over the New Year period.

media:group.media:description: Queensland police are disappointed in a spate of attacks in the far north over the New Year period. (ABC News: Giulio Saggin)

item.title: 'Nothing's changed': Jim Maxwell returns to Test cricket after stroke
item.description: Veteran ABC commentator Jim Maxwell returns to Test cricket coverage after suffering a stroke last year, and says for the most part, "it feels just like it's always felt".
item.dc:creator: Hayden Cooper

media:group.media:description: ABC commentator Jim Maxwell is back at work today covering Test cricket. (ABC News)

item.title: Corrections officer struck on head in riot at Bathurst prison
item.description: Bathurst prison staff contain a riot which involved 76 inmates in the jail's accommodation unit and saw one officer struck on the head several times by a prisoner.

media:group.media:description: The ambulance and fire services attended the incident at the Bathurst Correctional Complex. (ABC News: Luke Wong)

item.title: Video shows dangerously overloaded ute packed 'like sardines'
item.description: Queensland police release vision of 12 young people piling out of a 4WD ute as officers pull the car over in the early hours of New Year's Day.

media:group.media:description: Police said they found 12 people crammed into this ute when they pulled it over. (Supplied: QPS)

item.title: ANZ sells Shanghai bank stake for $1.8b
item.description: ANZ kicks off the new year by advancing its strategy to cut its retail presence in Asia, announcing the sale of its stake in Shanghai Rural Commercial Bank (SRCB).
item.dc:creator: Michael Janda

media:group.media:description: The logo of the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd. (ANZ) is displayed outside a bank branch in Sydney on Friday, April 8, 2011. (AAP Image: Sergio Dionisio)

item.title: Hong Kong's former leader pleads not guilty to penthouse bribery charge
item.description: Former Hong Kong leader Donald Tsang pleads not guilty to bribery charges relating to allegations he accepted refurbishments and redecoration work on a luxury penthouse he rented from a company owned by a major property tycoon.

media:group.media:description: Former Hong Kong Chief Executive Donald Tsang and his wife Selina arrive at the High Court. (Reuters: Bobby Yip)

item.title: Hundreds evacuated as forest fire destroys dozens of homes in Chile
item.description: A large fire fuelled by strong winds has burnt at least 100 homes, injured at least 19 and forced the evacuation of about 400 people near the Chilean port city of Valparaiso.

media:group.media:description: The fire sent heavy smoke down onto Valparaiso and drove authorities to evacuate hundreds of people. (AP: Luis Hidalgo)

item.title: Perth Airport worker critical after tanker mishap
item.description: A fuel tanker hits a worker on the tarmac at Perth Airport, leaving him in hospital with critical injuries.
item.dc:creator: Tom Wildie

media:group.media:description: The ground handler was hit by the tanker this morning. (ABC News: Irena Ceranic)

item.title: Brown snake filmed eating carpet python
item.description: An eastern brown snake is filmed eating a carpet python at a home west of Brisbane, with snake catchers saying a population boom could have driven the deadly predator to seek out its unusual meal.

media:group.media:description: The brown snake was filmed eating a python west of Brisbane. (Supplied: N&S Snake Catchers)

item.title: Call to end 'pink tax' in Australia as Tesco cuts price of female razors
item.description: Consumer experts urge Australian retailers to follow in the footsteps of British supermarket Tesco, after the chain says it will reduce the price of its basic women's razors to match that of its men's razors.

media:group.media:description: Experts say the "pink tax" is also a problem in Australia (Flickr: Billie Hara)

item.title: English and Hindi fuse to make 'Hinglish'
item.description: Forget labradoodles, the most popular hybrid you need to know about in 2017 is Hinglish — a blend of Hindi and English that is becoming increasingly popular in India.

media:group.media:description: In the Hindi-English hybrid language Hinglish, Filmi means glamorous. (Supplied:)

item.title: Consumer complaints to ACCC top 20,000 in 2016
item.description: Complaints about electronics and whitegoods accounted for more than a quarter of the 20,000-plus grievances shoppers submitted to the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission in 2016.
item.dc:creator: Thuy Ong

media:group.media:description: A customer looks at the the iPad released on March 16, 2012. (Reuters: Mark Blinch, file photo)

item.title: Hazardous fumes leak from silos in Victoria's east
item.description: Residents in the town of Trafalgar in Victoria's east are told to remain indoors after being warned hazardous fumes leaked from silos earlier today.

item.title: Dutton confident in PNG authorities after asylum seeker assault reports
item.description: Immigration Minister Peter Dutton says he has complete confidence in Papua New Guinea's authorities after reports asylum seekers were arrested and assaulted by police on New Year's Eve.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Anderson

media:group.media:description: The injured faces of two Manus Island asylum seekers who were allegedly beaten by 10 Papua New Guinea police and immigration officers on News Year's Eve 2016. January 1, 2017. (Supplied: Refugee Action Coalition)

item.title: Suspect flees after setting police car on fire in Hobart
item.description: An off-duty Tasmanian police officer investigates noises outside a private residence to discover his police car has been set on fire.

media:group.media:description: The suspect was seen getting into a white 4WD. (ABC News: Natalie Whiting)

item.title: 'We have grave concerns': Trouble ahead for the NDIS?
item.description: There are fears the ACT's problems with the NDIS — higher than expected enrolments, participants saying there are not enough support workers, and care providers saying the pay rates are too low — could flow on to other states and territories.
item.dc:creator: Norman Hermant

media:group.media:description: Leslea Geary, pictured with her children Annie, Kelsey and Tully, says there aren't enough qualified support workers to go around. (ABC News: Norman Hermant)

item.title: Warner in rare company with incredible pre-lunch century at SCG
item.description: David Warner produces a first-session innings at the SCG that places him in truly elite company, and that will stick in the memory of all who saw it.

media:group.media:description: Australia's David Warner jumps in the air to celebrate making 100 runs against Pakistan during their cricket test match in Sydney, Australia, Tuesday, Jan. 3, 2017. (AP: Rick Rycroft)

item.title: $11m X-ray upgrade to enhance detection of sophisticated drug concealments
item.description: The Australian Border Force (ABF) will spend more than $11 million to upgrade X-ray screening capability in container examination facilities around the country.
item.dc:creator: Connie Agius

media:group.media:description: The Australian Border Force will spend more than $11 million to upgrade X-ray screening technology. (ABC: Connie Agius)

item.title: 'They should be concerned': Port Augusta residents warned of ash
item.description: Residents in Port Augusta breathing in ash from the city's former coal-fired power station have good reason to be worried about their health, the Environment Protection Authority says.

media:group.media:description: Heavy rainfall has affected the suppressant used on the ash dams. (ABC News)

item.title: Brazil's notorious prisons built to 'annihilate, torture and kill'
item.description: The latest massacre in a Brazilian prison is the result of overcrowding and a broken truce between two of the countries biggest drug gangs, according to experts.

media:group.media:description: Riot police stand guard as hundreds of inmates are strip-searched during Brazil's biggest prison uprising in 2001. (Reuters)

item.title: Re-offending rates SA Government's top priority for prison inquiry
item.description: An inquiry into South Australia's prison system is set to look into a range of incidents including the death of an inmate but the Government says re-offending rates are its biggest concern.

media:group.media:description: Incidents at Port Augusta prison are expected to be reviewed during the inquiry. (ABC News: Nicola Gage)

item.title: Dylann Roof to represent himself in Charleston massacre sentencing
item.description: A US judge has ruled Dylann Roof was mentally fit to represent himself in the penalty phase of his trial, when a jury decides his sentence for the 2015 massacre at a South Carolina church.

media:group.media:description: Police lead Dylann Roof into the courthouse in Shelby, North Carolina in June 2015. (Reuters: Jason Miczek)

item.title: Police officer almost run down in hunt for suspected hit-run killer
item.description: NT police searching for two men suspected of killing a cyclist in Darwin on New Year's Eve spot and then lose the suspects' car after a chase on Monday during which a patrol car is hit and an officer almost run over.
item.dc:creator: Neda Vanovac

media:group.media:description: The car believed to be involved in the hit-and-run had the licence plate CB-31-FK. (Supplied: Northern Territory Police)

item.title: Singer puts condition on acceptance of Trump inauguration invitation
item.description: Singer Rebecca Ferguson says she will "graciously accept" an invitation to perform at US President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration on one condition — that she is allowed to sing Strange Fruit, a protest song most famously sung by Billie Holiday.

media:group.media:description: Rebecca Ferguson is the latest in a long line of performers who have been asked to appear. (Reuters: Craig Brough)

item.title: Capital city home prices surge nearly 11pc in 2016
item.description: Home prices in capital cities jump 10.9 per cent in 2016, the fastest calendar year growth since 2009, with Sydney and Melbourne easily leading the gains.
item.dc:creator: Thuy Ong And Michael Janda

media:group.media:description: An oversupply of apartments in some areas is seeing weak rental growth and lower price growth. (Audience submitted: Edwin Almeida)

item.title: 25 dead in fiery crash on Thai highway
item.description: Twenty-five people die when a van and a ute collided and caught fire on a highway in eastern Thailand.

media:group.media:description: Authorities say a van and a pickup collided and caught fire on a highway in eastern Thailand. (AP: Matichon TV)

item.title: Man bitten by snake in the Blue Mountains rescued
item.description: A man bitten by a snake is winched to safety after spending the night stranded in the Blue Mountains National Park with paramedics.
item.dc:creator: Riley Stuart

item.title: Syrian rebels freeze peace talks over ceasefire 'violations'
item.description: Syrian rebel groups say they have decided will not discuss their possible participation in Syrian peace negotiations due to what they say are ceasefire "violations" by the army and Iran-backed militias.

media:group.media:description: Syrian soldiers, who have defected to join the Free Syrian Army, hold up their rifles as they secure a street in Saqba, in Damascus suburbs, January 27, 2012. (Reuters: Ahmed Jadallah, file)

item.title: The Castle house saved with plans to relocate it to NSW
item.description: The suburban Melbourne house used to film The Castle may have been saved from the threat of being demolished, with a proposed plan to move to New South Wales.
item.dc:creator: Tom Nightingale

media:group.media:description: Mr Eden hopes the house will become a commercial tourist attraction. (Supplied: Village Roadshow)

item.title: Melbourne City coach John van 't Schip resigns
item.description: Melbourne City coach John van 't Schip resigns from his post to return to his native Holland, in order to contribute to the palliative care of his father.

media:group.media:description: John van 't Schip's reign as Melbourne City coach has ended. (AAP: Tracey Nearmy)

item.title: SpaceX to return to flight after costly helium canister explosion
item.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX plans to resume flying rockets next week following an investigation into why one of them burst into flames on a launch pad four months ago.

media:group.media:description: Smoke rises after an explosion at the SpaceX launch facility at Cape Canaveral. (YouTube: Dennis Kapatos)

item.title: Why bad housing design pumps up prices for everyone
item.description: Did you know that relying on air conditioners to stay cool on hot summer days affects the price of electricity for everyone, all year round?

media:group.media:description: Did you know relying on aircon to stay cool in summer affects the price of power all year around? (Flickr: kaptainkobold)

item.title: As it happened: Australia builds big score on day one against Pakistan
item.description: Matt Renshaw makes his maiden Test century for Australia in an innings of patience after David Warner's spectacular 113 at the SCG.
item.dc:creator: James Maasdorp And Jon Healy

media:group.media:description: Australia's Matt Renshaw celebrates making 100 runs against Pakistan during their cricket test match in Sydney, Australia, Tuesday, Jan. 3, 2017. (AP: Rick Rycroft)

item.title: Finland trial pays unemployed a monthly income
item.description: Finland becomes the first country in Europe to pay its unemployed citizens a basic monthly income in a trial that aims to cut government red tape, reduce poverty and boost employment.

media:group.media:description: A Five Euro note, June 2011. (Flickr: Images_of_Money)

item.title: Porter defends Centrelink amid debt recovery row
item.description: Social Services Minister Christian Porter defends the Federal Government's new debt recovery system by Centrelink following claims some people have been mistakenly targeted.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Anderson

media:group.media:description: Exterior of a Centrelink office at Bondi Junction in Sydney in May, 2009. (Tracey Nearmy, file photo: AAP)

item.title: SA Government 'wasted' $150,000 on consultants during pay negotiations: Opposition
item.description: The Opposition questions the skill level of the South Australian Transport Department after Freedom of Information documents reveal the Government paid consultants to deal with train driver enterprise agreement negotiations.

media:group.media:description: The dispute between the Government and the union started in 2014 and ended last month. (ABC News: Candice Marcus)

item.title: Pistol club offers people with disabilities chance to thrive in shooting classes
item.description: A central Queensland pistol club running shooting classes for people with an intellectual disability is hoping to find Australia's next Paralympic talent.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Hair

media:group.media:description: Classes for people with a disability have been running at the club for the past 18 months. (ABC News: Jonathan Hair)

item.title: Drug drivers nabbed leaving rave where man died from unknown drug
item.description: Five people who attended the same rave where a man died after taking an unknown drug on New Year's Day are charged with drug driving during a major traffic operation.
item.dc:creator: Elise Kinsella

media:group.media:description: More than 500 people attended the rave at Mount Lindesay over the long weekend. (ABC News)

item.title: Pope tells bishops to maintain 'zero tolerance' for child abuse
item.description: Pope Francis writes to Catholic bishops worldwide reminding them to adhere to a "zero tolerance" policy on child sexual abuse to ensure that "such crimes may never be repeated" by clergy.

media:group.media:description: Pope Francis asked bishops to "ensure these atrocities will no longer take place in our midst". (Reuters: Tony Gentile)

item.title: Elderly inmate charged after allegedly bashing 71yo cellmate to death with sandwich press
item.description: John Walsh, 77, is charged with murder after allegedly bashing to death his 71-year-old cellmate with a sandwich press in the frail aged unit at Sydney's Long Bay jail complex.
item.dc:creator: Danuta Kozaki And Jessica Kidd

media:group.media:description: John Walsh is serving a life sentence for the murder of his wife and two grandchildren in 2008. (Fairfax Media)

item.title: Smith eyeing off greatness after 50 Tests
item.description: Steve Smith is set to play his 50th Test with a record greater than most — but the Aussie skipper is looking firmly to the future, not the past.

media:group.media:description: Steve Smith's first 50 Tests have been sensational — what will the next 50 bring? (AAP: Julian Smith)

item.title: Flash flooding hits Brisbane after slow-moving storm
item.description: More than 80 people call on the State Emergency Service for help, Fortitude Valley train station is temporarily flooded and power is cut to about 6,000 properties as a storm rolls over south-east Queensland.

media:group.media:description: Flooding forced debris onto a footbridge over Kedron Brook. (ABC News: Elizabeth Pickering)

item.title: Israeli police question PM over corruption allegations
item.description: Israeli police question Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over allegations he received gifts from two businessmen.

media:group.media:description: Benjamin Netanyahu has denied reports he accepted gifts from businessmen. (Reuters: Abir Sultan, file)

item.title: Ex-judge Richard Gee dies after being found in pool
item.description: Richard Gee, a former judge who survived the bombing of his Sydney home more than 30 years ago, dies after being pulled unconscious from a backyard swimming pool on the northern beaches.

media:group.media:description: Former Family Court judge Richard Gee survived the bombing of his family home in the 1980s. (Supplied)

item.title: Inmates decapitated, quartered in Brazilian prison riot that left dozens dead
item.description: An attack by members of one crime gang on rival inmates touches off a riot at a Brazilian prison that left at least 56 dead, including several who were beheaded or dismembered.

media:group.media:description: The wife of a prisoner who was killed in the riot cries outside the prison. (AP: Edmar Barros/Futura Press)

item.title: Millionaire Wotif founder behind Facebook ads attacking salmon farm
item.description: Graeme Wood confirms he is supporting a Facebook advertising campaign that attacks plans for salmon farming near his proposed tourism development on Tasmania's east coast.
item.dc:creator: Laura Beavis

media:group.media:description: Graeme Wood has said he is "one of many" supporters of the LGTF group. (ABC News)

item.title: Stranger found asleep under doona holds knife to woman's throat
item.description: Victorian police are looking for a man who allegedly held a knife to a woman's throat after he was found sleeping on a bed he dragged into the living room of a Melbourne home last week.

media:group.media:description: The man dragged a bed into the living room of the Doncaster house from a bedroom. (Supplied: Victoria Police)

item.title: Abbott's embassy stance 'welcome news in Israel'
item.description: Tony Abbott's call to move Australia's embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem is welcomed in Israel, an Israeli Government MP says.
item.dc:creator: Julia Holman

media:group.media:description: Tony Abbott met with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu during a Middle East visit last month. (Twitter: Israel Foreign Min.)

item.title: Karta's keepers nervous as orangutan's due date nears
item.description: After losing six previous babies, Karta the orangutan is pregnant again and expected to give birth any day now, leaving Adelaide zookeepers excited, but also on edge.
item.dc:creator: Nicola Gage

media:group.media:description: Karta the orangutan is pregnant and is expected to give birth any day now. (ABC News: Tony Hill)

item.title: Turkish police 'close to identifying Istanbul nightclub gunman'
item.description: The Turkish Government detains eight people in connection with the deadly weekend attack on an Istanbul nightclub that killed 39 people as investigators edge closer to identifying the gunman.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Millar

media:group.media:description: A grainy image of the suspected attacker has been released by police. (AP: CCTV via Haberturk Newspaper)

item.title: Turkey faces tourist exodus after nightclub attack
item.description: Turkey's tourism industry used to be big part of its economy, but the latest terrorism attack will weigh heavily on the country's already dwindling visitors.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Millar

media:group.media:description: Crowds outside the Blue Mosque, one of Istanbul's biggest drawcards, were thin with very few Westerners. (ABC News: Lisa Millar)

item.title: Myanmar to take action after Rakhine assault video goes viral
item.description: Myanmar's Government vows to take action against police officers who assaulted villagers in Rakhine State, after a video of the incident circulates on the internet.

media:group.media:description: Myanmar police officers were filmed beating villagers in Rakhine State. (YouTube: Arakan Times)

item.title: Besart Berisha notches A-League record as Jets crash
item.description: A fourth straight win returns Melbourne Victory to within seven points of A-League leaders Sydney FC.

media:group.media:description: Victory player Besart Berisha kicks a penalty goal with his famed intensity. (AAP: Julian Smith)

item.title: Dan Christian shines in Hurricanes' win over Strikers
item.description: Hobart Hurricanes post an eight-wicket Big Bash League win over Adelaide Strikers thanks partly to a five-wicket haul by Dan Christian.

media:group.media:description: Hurricanes Captain Tim Paine hits a six during the match at Bellerive Oval. (AAP: Rob Blakers)

item.title: Man 'seeking workers' kills 36 in Baghdad market blast
item.description: A suicide bomber who pretended to be a businessman seeking to hire labourers kills dozens of people when he detonates a ute loaded with explosives in a bustling market in Baghdad.

media:group.media:description: Citizens inspect the scene after the car bomb explosion. (AP: Karim Kadim)

item.title: Human hair, rocket launchers now cheaper to export to China
item.description: Export tariffs to China for many Australian products, including human hair and some military weapons, are decreased for the new year.
item.dc:creator: Uma Patel

media:group.media:description: Human and animal hair now attract lower export tariffs. (ABC News: Lucinda Kent)

item.title: Ravensthorpe nickel mine fined for near-fatal acid accident
item.description: The Canadian owners of the Ravensthorpe nickel mine in WA's south are fined $40,000 after a near-fatal acid spill two years ago.

item.title: PNG soldiers, police clash in Port Moresby

item.title: Fly ash plume leaves Port Augusta residents fuming
item.description: Plumes of fly ash from Port Augusta's old coal-fired power station are raising health concerns for residents.

item.title: Python makes meal of wallaby in horse paddock near Cairns
item.description: A 3-metre scrub python makes a meal out of a wallaby in far north Queensland on New Year's Day, just weeks after another python did likewise on a golf course a short distance away.

item.title: Taking the pension 'nothing to be proud of', Leyonhjelm says

item.title: WA Opposition blames Government for high road toll

item.title: Experts struggle to stop fireworks black market

item.title: What can we expect from Australian climate politics in 2017?

item.title: Fifth straight year of superannuation growth

item.title: Ronda Rousey contemplates future after comeback loss
item.description: Ronda Rousey, once the most feared woman in the UFC, says she will have "take time to reflect" after a heavy loss to Amanda Nunes in her comeback fight.

item.title: White House photographer shares final Year in Photographs
item.description: Chief White House photographer Pete Souza releases his eighth and final Year in Photographs collection, comprising some of the best moments captured from inside the Obama administration in 2016.

media:group.media:description: Barack Obama deep in thought. (Supplied: White House/Pete Souza)

item.title: Teen battles elements, food poisoning to snag first coin of 2017
item.description: Dedication pays off for a Canberra teenager who spent a week camped outside the Royal Australian Mint to claim the first coin struck anywhere in the world in 2017.

item.title: Inmates damage Perth's juvenile detention centre
item.description: There has been more trouble at the Banksia Hill Detention Centre, with three juvenile inmates causing damage to the facility before climbing on the roof and allegedly throwing concrete at officers.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gartry

media:group.media:description: There have been numerous incidents at Banksia Hill Detention Centre in recent times.

item.title: Woman killed in hit-and-run after argument with man
item.description: A woman dies after being hit by a car following a verbal altercation with a man in Cairns overnight.

item.title: Cahill responds to Mariners' ballkid shenanigans
item.description: Tim Cahill shows he is a good sport after being the butt of a New Year's prank by a ballboy which is drawing worldwide attention.

media:group.media:description: Tim Cahill made sure to grab some photos with his ballboy adversary after the match. (AAP: Dan Himbrechts)

item.title: South Sudanese refugee making a difference through hip-hop music
item.description: Adelaide musician Gabriel Akon establishes an online record label to help hip-hop artists across the state and hopes his music can help make a difference to people in Australia and East Africa.

media:group.media:description: Gabriel Akon fled war-torn Sudan when he was 10 years old. (ABC News)

item.title: Teen falls six storeys from balcony on New Year's Eve
item.description: A teenager is in a critical condition after falling about six storeys from a balcony on the Sunshine Coast, while a police officer will require surgery to his hand following a separate incident on New Year's Eve in Queensland.

item.title: 39 dead in New Year 'terror attack' on Istanbul nightclub
item.description: Turkish police hunt a gunman who shot his way into an Istanbul nightclub packed with New Year's revellers, killing at least 39 people and wounding almost 70 others in what the provincial Governor describes as a terrorist attack.

media:group.media:description: Turkish police officers block the road leading to the scene of an attack in Istanbul, early Sunday, Jan. 1, 2017. (Depo/AP)

item.title: Wall of wheelie bins used in attempt to lead rogue croc back to water

media:group.media:description: A wall of wheelie bins was used by Karumba residents and police on New Year's Eve 2016 to try and lure a large crocodile, found in a backyard, back to the water. (Supplied: Queensland Police Service)

item.title: Queenslanders praised by police for NYE behaviour

item.title: Police assaulted after New Year's Eve boat chase
item.description: Police charge two men after an on-water chase on the NSW south coast which ended in an altercation where one of the men allegedly assaulted officers.

item.title: UN Security Council welcomes Syria ceasefire
item.description: The United Nations Security Council welcomes a ceasefire in the Syrian civil war, but rebel groups threaten to abandon the two-day-old truce if violations persist.

media:group.media:description: The UN Security Council unanimously adopted the resolution on Syria. (AP: Craig Ruttle)

item.title: New laws cut red tape for builders, renovators in Tasmania
item.description: Home improvements in Tasmania are set to become a lot easier with new building laws coming into effect today.

item.title: Zlatan's record golazo cruelly ruled out by referee blunder

item.title: Proposal for world's tallest building on 1986 Queensland cabinet agenda

item.title: NT release Cabinet documents on Azaria Chamberlain case

item.title: Keating era documents offer glimpse into 1992 Australia

item.title: Cabinet papers detail post-Cold War Russian spying concerns

item.title: Sydney Sixers collapse helps Adelaide Strikers to BBL win
